subject: RE: [junit] How to write effective tests?
msgSnippet: I would reccomend Kent Beck s latest:  Test Driven Development: By Example. It provides a chapter describing the thought process developing test first, and
messageBody:
I would reccomend Kent Beck's latest: Test Driven Development: By Example.
It provides a chapter describing the thought process developing test first,
and provides general testing patterns and scenarios.

http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0321146530/qid=1043244849/sr=8
-1/ref=sr_8_1/103-7232801-5915015?v=glance&s=books&n=507846


-----Original Message-----
From: Lee Chalupa [mailto:lchalupa@...]

Can anyone point me towards a book that give some practical insights into
the thinking process a programmer goes through to write a good set of
tests?

Thanks

lee
